titleStmt.title: Francis Boott, London, to Sir James Edward Smith, Norwich, [Norfolk]

seriesStmt.ab: The Correspondence of Sir James Edward Smith, The Linnean Society's Archive Catalogue

sourceDesc.bibl: GB-110/JES/COR/20/109, The Linnean Society of London

abstract.p: Sending plants from Jacob Bigelow by coach. Introduces himself; brother of the Mr Boott who has occasionally transmitted plants to Smith; will be resident in Britain for 2 to 3 years, during which he will devote himself to botany in his free time so as to be useful in this area on return to USA; would like to establish correspondence with interested people though admits Bigelow the most knowledgeable on American flora. He has left the 'Salicorna' and bark at Sir Joseph Banks'.
Brought a "very superior" collection of drawings of fungi by Mrs [Lucy] Hardcastle [(fl 1760s-1830s] to Banks'; believes some are new species.
